oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Calvary United Methodist, 2001 March
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Calvary United Methodist Church located at 3701 Hillsboro Road. This church was built in the 1940s. The exterior walls are red brick with cross gables near the rear of the building. There is a low gabled roof made of copper sheet material. The windows are arched on the upper portion of the sanctuary with a pink tint and square on the lower portion, also with a pink tint. One clean glass square window rests over the front door, and an octagonal oculus window is present at the steeple's base. Special features include a slightly towered steeple needle with a cross on top and four square columns supporting the gabled porch. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Calvary United Methodist Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
